title: The Standard model within noncommutative geometry: a comparison of models
abstract: Algebraic Yang-Mills-Higgs theories based on noncommutative geometry have brought forth novel extensions of gauge theories with interesting applications to phenomenology. We sketch the model of Connes and Lott, as well as variants of it, and the model developed by a Mainz-Marseille group, by comparing them in a schematic way. The role of fermion masses and mixings is discussed, and the question of possible parameter relations is briefly touched.
